str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: A strengthened form of melo; to intend, i.e. Be about to be, do, or suffer something.
To examine (a person on trial, a witness) judicially (frequently by the aid of torture). From ana and etazo; to investigate.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From apo and histemi; to remove, i.e. instigate to revolt; usually to desist, desert, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A commander of a thousand men, a military tribune. From chilioi and archo; the commander of a thousand soldiers
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From phobos; to frighten, i.e. to be alarmed; by analogy, to be in awe of, i.e. Revere.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From epi and ginosko; to know upon some mark, i.e. Recognize; by implication, to become fully acquainted with, to acknowledge.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To bind, tie, fasten; I impel, compel; I declare to be prohibited and unlawful. A primary verb; to bind.
Roman; subst: a Roman citizen. From Rhome; Romaean, i.e. Roman.
